posts.message:
Geeks, a while before I was ranting on about how I felt sad for my favourite Linux distro dying #!. I asked a question which I could not find a satisfying answer to:

What makes a Linux Distro?

As I now have a great resource for this I would like to share:

This is the new #! ++ distro configuration files, I am personally looking around and understanding how things work. I can see files with package lists mainly and scripts for user inititaization plus themes, icons and other UI stuff.

I thought I would share with those who want to see a Linux distro being created live
posts.caption: github.com

posts.message: My favourite #Linux Distro is save yay for #! ++
posts.caption: crunchbangplusplus.org
posts.description: HEADS UP Keep in mind, as the distro is currently based off of the Debian netinst, an internet connection will be required. This is in no way a finished product. The Beta is currently more of a proof-of-concept than a full fledged release. As such, some breakage may arise through normal use. Regardl…

posts.caption: djangoproject.com
posts.description: As we reported last week, the fundraising campaign for the Django Fellowship has been incredibly successful. We blew past our initial target in a little over 6 days, and we're well on the way to hit our stretch goal. Given this success, it's time to put that money to good use, and hire some Fellows.

The format is designed to maximize readability and ease of implementation, even for hobbyist programmers, artists and graffiti writers. Popular…

posts.message:
Installing Mac OS X on your Windows PC/Laptop was never easier.
I'm here for any questions.
Please note that some hardware components may not be compatible with the OS..it's kinda hit and miss so just try your luck!
I'm posting this from my custom fully-operational Hackintosh.
